DOC.brief_summary: Stress hyperglycemia occurs in 50-85% of patients admitted to a medical intensive care unit (MICU) and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. However, randomized controlled trials examining the effects of strict glycemic control demonstrated conflicting results. A common finding in these trials was the high risk of hypoglycaemia. This randomized controlled trial evaluates the impact of real-time continuous glucose monitoring (RT-CGM) on glycemic control and risk of hypoglycemia in severely ill MICU patients with an APACHE-II (Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II) score ≥20.
DOC.brief_title: Glucose Control in the ICU Using Continuous Glucose Monitoring
DOC.criteria: Patients admitted to a medical intensive care unit age: ≥ 18 y , < 75 y APACHE II (Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II) score ≥ 20 expected length of stay in ICU > 3 days pregnancy patient with a DNR (do not reanimate) code surgical patient no informed consent
